results.title: Shanghai noon
results.creator_credit: Tom Dey, Jonathan Glickman, Roger Birnbaum, Gary Barber, Touchstone Pictures, Spyglass Entertainment and Jackie Chan Films
results.brief_description: A case of East meets West in this comic adventure Jackie Chan film set in 1850s American West. Chon Wang (Jackie Chan), an Imperial Guard, is sent across to America as part of a rescue team to find the Emperor’s kidnapped daughter, Princess Pei Pei (Lucy Liu). However it is not long before Chon Wang becomes separated from the search party and finds himself lost out in the vast open spaces of the West where he has a timely encounter with a bright but arrogant train robber by the name of Roy O’Bannon (Owen Wilson). The two become unlikely allies. Cast also includes Brandon Merrill, Roger Yuan.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Tom Dey, Jonathan Glickman, Roger Birnbaum, Gary Barber, Touchstone Pictures, Spyglass Entertainment and Jackie Chan Films

results.title: Down and out in Beverly Hills
results.creator_credit: Paul Mazursky, Pato Guzman and Touchstone Pictures
results.brief_description: A wealthy but bitterly unhappy married couple take in a tramp who attempts suicide in their pool. Becoming ensconced in their lives, the tramp (played by Nick Nolte) facilitates a re-evaluation of the family’s dubious moral codes. A remake of Jean Renoir’s 1932 film “Boudu saved from drowning” this hilarious comedy with Richard Dreyfuss and Bette Midler as the warring couple, garnered many accolades and was nominated for two Golden Globes.

results.title: The Last flight of Noah's Ark
results.creator_credit: Charles Jarrott, Ron Miller and Walt Disney Productions
results.brief_description: When a vintage B-29 bomber strays from its course over the Pacific, its crew - a high-living pilot, a prim missionary and two stowaway orphans - is forced to beach it on an unmapped tropical island. Stranded, they plot their way back to civilization. Stars Elliott Gould, Genevieve Bujold, Ricky Schroder, and Vincent Gardenia.

results.title: Insomnia (1997)
results.creator_credit: Erik Skjoldbjaerg, Tom Remlov, Tomas Backstrom, Petter Borgli, Nordic Screen Production AS and Norsk Film
results.brief_description: Edgy police thriller set in Norway and the original version of this title. A police detective (Stellan Skarsgard) is flown in from Sweeden to a small rural town in Norway to help solve the murder of a teenage schoolgirl. In pursuit of the suspect in deep fog, his partner is shot and the accident leads the murderer to blackmail the detective. Due to the Midnight Sun and the stress of the situation he finds himself in, the detective suffers from insomnia which impacts on his judgement in dealing with his partner’s death. Tense and brooding the film questions the role of police as the enforcers of the law when they themselves are not above its constructs. Co-written and directed by Erik Skjoldbjaerg this is a compelling first-time feature. Cast includes Sverre Anker Ousdal, Bjorn Floberg, Gisken Armand, Maria Bonnevie.

results.title: Tin men
results.creator_credit: Barry Levinson, Mark Johnson and Touchstone Pictures
results.brief_description: A tale of two hustlers in competition with each other, one a smooth-talking ladies’ man, the other a loser surrounded by debt and emotional problems. Set in 1960s Baltimore, BB Bakowsky (Richard Dreyfus) and Ernest Tilley (Danny De Vito) are rival aluminium siding salesmen brought together through an unfortunate car accident. Each blames the other and a full-on feud ensues. Revenge becomes a game and BB succeeds in making life even more complicated when in order to infuriate Tilley, he attempts to sleep with Tilley’s wife, Nora (Barbara Hershey) only to end up falling in love with her. Although the dialogue is fast and furious with many hilarious scenes there is sense of a darker sadder story underneath. Cast includes John Mahoney, Seymour Cassel, Jackie Gayle.

results.title: Kama sutra: a tale of love
results.creator_credit: Mira Nair, Lydia Dean Pilcher, Pandora Films, Pony Canyon, NDF International and Mirabai Films
results.brief_description: Centred on the text The Kama Sutra this is a film about class and politics in sixteenth century India - a lush melodrama, featuring explicit sexual posturing. Initially it is the story of two women: Maya, a rebellious servant girl and Tara her mistress and future queen, childhood friends who become adult rivals. Publicly humiliated during Tara’s nuptial celebrations, a vengeful Maya seduces the king prior to his wedding night. Consequently Maya is spurned and turned out into the street, despite the king’s burgeoning obsession for her. Maya has an affair with a sculptor of erotic deities, before training as a courtesan, returning to the palace as a professional seductress. Meanwhile the king has fallen into an opium addled, hedonistic stupor that threatens the future of the kingdom. Mira Nair’s (Mississippi Masala, Salaam Bombay!, Monsoon Wedding) film operates as a critique of the class system and is a tract about self-determination and sexual politics, but it is overwhelmed by a simplistic script and predictable character developments. Nair may have been reaching for a feminist interpretation of the classic erotic text, as well as a narrative about spiritual awakening, but the key joys here are the rich colourful palette and exotic setting.

results.title: Blackbeard's ghost
results.creator_credit: Robert Stevenson and Walt Disney Productions
results.brief_description: The legendary pirate Blackbeard is cursed to wander in limbo until he performs a good deed. He gets his chance when he decides to help a local college track team that hasn’t a ghost of a chance of winning! Cast includes Peter Ustinov, Dean Jones, Suzanne Pleshette, Elsa Lanchester. Based on the book by Ben Stahl.

results.title: Gone in 60 seconds = Gone in sixty seconds
results.creator_credit: Dominic Sena, Mike Stenson, Jerry Bruckheimer and Touchstone Pictures
results.brief_description: In this remake of H. B. Halicki’s cult favourite, Nicholas Cage stars as Randall “Memphis” Raines, a master car thief whose desire to get out of the game is compromised when his brother becomes embroiled with a dangerous criminal. To save his brother Memphis must steal fifty cars in one evening, a task he undertakes with the aid of a motley crew. At the same time, another gang is undertaking the same challenge and the police are hot on the trail of both. Cast also includes Angelina Jolie, Giovanni Ribisi, Will Patton, Robert Duvall.

results.title: Arachnophobia
results.creator_credit: Frank Marshall, Richard Vane, Kathleen Kennedy, Amblin Entertainment and Hollywood Pictures
results.brief_description: A doctor who is deathly afraid of spiders moves his family to a small town where the arachnids are attacking the townspeople. He must overcome his fear to save the community, but it may already be too late! Cast includes Jeff Daniels, Julian Sands, Harley Jane Kozak, John Goodman.

results.title: The Great mouse detective
results.creator_credit: John Musker, David Michener, Burny Mattinson, Ron Clements and Walt Disney Pictures
results.brief_description: Early computer animated Disney feature, features the mellifluous tones of Vincent Price as Professor Rattigan, a Sherlock Homes type character who is a master of mystery sleuthing. Set in Victoria London, England Rattigan (a highly intelligent scientific mouse) is joined by various cohorts on the trail of the abducted father of a little mouse. An entertaining effort directed at children, that charms in many ways with its gentle humour and fun characterisations.
